Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; glaze fired chocolate; white slip; interior glazed (heavily chipped); exterior: frieze of lotus flower and bud above narrow and wide bands.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.468.j and 1965,0930.300; the condition of the inside surface of the trio is strikingly similar.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 253, no. 406)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0107) (phase 2)
